1.label: When do startups generally pay dividends?

options.1: As soon as the investment is made
options.2: After the first 3 years
options.3: They do not pay dividends

2.label: What happens if the startup I invest in fails?

options.1: The business will pay back my investment
options.2: I will lose the money I invested
options.3: Seedrs will pay back my investment

3.label: Can I get my money back after I invest?

options.1: Startup shares are illiquid, I will need to wait for an exit event
options.2: I can sell my shares on a stock exchange at any point
options.3: The business will buy my shares back whenever I want

4.label: If a startup issues further shares, how will this impact my investment?

options.1: My equity holding will be diluted
options.2: I will be granted free shares to maintain my equity
options.3: There would be no impact

5.label: How should you invest into startups?

options.1: Invest all available money into one investment
options.2: Only invest 10% of investable money into a diversified portfolio of startups
options.3: Invest all available money into multiple investments

1.label: If a startup issues further shares, how will this impact your shareholding?

options.1: My proportion of shareholding increases
options.2: My proportion of shareholding will decrease due to dilution.
options.3: My proportion of shareholding stays the same

2.label: Can I sell my shares at any point?

options.1: I will need to wait for an exit event
options.2: I will easily be able to find someone to buy my shares privately
options.3: The business will buy my shares back

3.label: Will the Financial Ombundsman Service compensate me for poor performance of an investment?

options.1: Seedrs will refund my investment
options.2: The Financial Ombundsman Service will refund my investment
options.3: I will not receive any compensation

4.label: Should I do my own research before I make an invetsment?

options.1: No, Seedrs already does it for me
options.2: Yes I should research the invetsment opportunity before investing
options.3: No, there's no need to do any research before making a high risk investment

5.label: What is the best way to invest in startup?

options.1: Pick a selection of businesses and invest all my money into them
options.2: Pick one business and invest all my money in it
options.3: Diversify my portfolio by investing in lots of businesses

1.label: What will happen to my shareholdings if a company issues more shares after I have invested?

options.1: My percentage of shareholding will decrease due to dilution
options.2: My percentage of shareholding will increase due to dilution
options.3: My percentage of shareholding in the business will always remain the same

2.label: What happens if the start-up business I invest in fails?

options.1: Seedrs will offer loss relief of 30% of your initial investment
options.2: I am unlikely to lose all the money I have invested
options.3: I will lose the money I invested

3.label: Do start-up businesses generally pay dividends?

options.1: Only mature startup businesses pay dividends
options.2: Start up businesses do not pay dividends
options.3: Startup businesses pay dividends periodically

options.1: Only the issuance of securities from the underlying business is FCA regulated
options.2: Crowdfunding is not an FCA regulated activity
options.3: Yes my investment in the crowdfunding campaign is an FCA regulated activity

5.label: What if I want to sell my shares in a start-up business I have invested in?

options.1: Aside from selling my shares on the Seedrs Secondary Market, which is not guaranteed, I will not be able to sell my shares until the company is acquired or goes public
options.2: I will be able to sell my shares in the business at any point through a private broker
options.3: There will be an opportunity to sell your shares back to the company through share buy-backs

1.label: How much should I generally invest in startup businesses?

options.1: I shouldn't invest more than 10% of my net assets in startup businesses
options.2: I should invest the majority of my money into startup businesses, as long as I invest the rest into safer investments
options.3: I should invest an even proportion of my money into startups and safe investments

2.label: Do I need to conduct any of my own due diligence when investing in startups?

options.1: Seedrs conducts sufficient due diligence on all startups, so you don't need to do any of your own
options.2: Seedrs recommends that investors always conduct their own due diligence on any investment opportunity
options.3: You only need to conduct due diligence on startups which are less than 2 years old

3.label: If startups issue further shares will this have any impact on me?

options.1: Startups cannot issue any further shares once they have completed a crowdfunding raise
options.2: If startups issue further shares they must always be on the same terms as existing investors
options.3: Startups can issue further shares which may grant preferential rights that negatively impact existing investors

4.label: What protection is available if the start-up business I invest in fails?

options.1: The Financial Services Compensation Scheme will reimburse your investment up to 30%
options.2: Seedrs will offer loss relief of 30% of your initial investment
options.3: I will not receive any protection from the Financial Services Compensation Scheme if the investment performs poorly

5.label: Will I receive any dividends from the start-up businesses I invest in?

options.1: Start up businesses do not pay dividends
options.2: Start up businesses pay dividends periodically, once they reach a certain stage of maturity
options.3: Start up businesses only pay dividends within the first year of investment

1.label: What protection is available if the start-up business I invest in fails?

options.1: I will only receive protection from the Financial Ombudsman Service for poor investment performance
options.2: I will not receive any compensation from the Financial Ombudsman Service if the investment performs poorly
options.3: The Financial Ombudsman Service caps compensation for poor investment performance at 30%

2.label: If a startup business I invest in decides to issue more shares after I have invested, what happens to my shareholding?

options.1: Dilution will not affect my investment in startup businesses
options.2: Due to dilution, my proportion of shareholding will increase
options.3: Due to dilution, my proportion of shareholding will decrease

3.label: What happens if the start-up business I invest in fails?

options.1: I will lose the money I invested
options.2: You will only lose your money if it is the first startup investment
options.3: The business may offer loss relief of 30% of your investment

4.label: What if I want to cash in on the success of a start-up business I have invested in?

options.1: Typically, I will not easily be able to sell my shares unless the company is acquired by another company or goes public
options.2: Typically, I will be able to find someone to buy my shares in the business by using a private broker
options.3: Typically, the business' founders will offer to buy back my shares

options.1: Crowdfunding is not an FCA regulated activity
options.2: The FCA only regulates the issuance of shares by the startup business
options.3: My investment through Seedrs into the crowdfunding campaign is an FCA regulated activity

1.label: Which of these is the best method to use when investing in start-up businesses?

options.1: You should spread the risk by allocating most of your money into startups
options.2: You should invest all of your money into one company
options.3: You should allocate the majority of your available money into safe investments and spread your risk by investing small amounts in multiple companies

2.label: Generally, how much should I invest into startup businesses?

options.1: I shouldn't invest more than 10% of my net assets in startup businesses
options.2: I should invest an even proportion of my money into startups and safe investments
options.3: I should invest the most of my money into startup businesses, as long as I invest the rest into safer investments

3.label: What happens if the start-up business I invest in fails?

options.1: I will only receive protection from the Financial Services Compensation Scheme for poor investment performance
options.2: I will not receive any protection from the Financial Services Compensation Scheme or the Financial Ombudsman Service if the investment performs poorly
options.3: Seedrs will offer loss relief of 30% of your investment

4.label: Do I need to conduct any of my own due diligence when investing in startups?

options.1: Seedrs conducts sufficient due diligence on all startups, so you don't need to do any of your own
options.2: I should conduct my own due diligence on the investment opportunity
options.3: I only need to conduct my own due diligence on startups which are raising for the first time

5.label: Will I receive any dividends from the start-up businesses I invest in?

options.1: Start up businesses do not pay dividends
options.2: Start up businesses only pay dividends within the first year of investment
options.3: Startup businesses pay dividends periodically
